intro: Pseudechinolaena camusiana var. camusiana, commonly known as the Camusiana pseudechinolaena, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. This variety is noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor conditions.
